introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.paragraph1: Plastic Clever Schools ("we," "our," or "us") is committed to protecting your privacy and the privacy of students participating in our program. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use the Plastic Clever Schools platform.
introduction.paragraph2: Plastic Clever Schools is managed by Common Seas, a UK-registered charity, in partnership with Kids Against Plastic. We comply with all applicable data protection laws, including the UK General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA).

subsection1_1.title: 1.1 School and Teacher Information
subsection1_1.intro: When you register a school or create a teacher account, we collect:
items: School name, address, country, and contact information
Teacher names and email addresses
Account credentials (usernames and encrypted passwords)
Role information (head teacher, teacher, pending teacher)
Language preferences

subsection1_2.title: 1.2 Evidence and Program Data
subsection1_2.intro: As schools participate in the program, we collect:
items: Photos, videos, and documents submitted as evidence
Plastic audit data and reduction promises
Progress through program stages (Inspire, Investigate, Act)
Case study content and success stories
Event registrations and participation records

subsection1_3.title: 1.3 Student Information
subsection1_3.intro: We do not directly collect personal information from students. However, photos or videos submitted by schools may include student images. Schools are responsible for:
items: Obtaining appropriate parental/guardian consent before submitting student images
Ensuring compliance with local data protection laws
Anonymizing or obscuring student identities when appropriate

subsection1_4.title: 1.4 Automatically Collected Information
subsection1_4.intro: When you use our platform, we automatically collect:
items: IP addresses and device information
Browser type and version
Pages visited and time spent on the platform
Referring websites and search terms
Login times and session information

section2.title: 2. How We Use Your Information
section2.intro: We use the information we collect to:
items: Operate the Program: Manage school registrations, track progress, and provide platform access
Evidence Review: Review and approve evidence submissions, provide feedback, and award recognition
Communication: Send program updates, resources, event notifications, and newsletters
Showcase Success: Feature approved evidence and case studies in our inspiration gallery to motivate other schools
Analytics: Analyze platform usage, track program impact, and generate anonymized statistics
Improvement: Enhance platform features, user experience, and educational resources
Support: Respond to inquiries, provide technical assistance, and resolve issues
Legal Compliance: Fulfill legal obligations and protect our rights and interests

section3.title: 3. Legal Basis for Processing (GDPR)
section3.intro: Under GDPR, we process your personal data based on the following legal grounds:
items: Consent: You have given explicit consent for us to process your information for specific purposes (e.g., newsletter subscriptions)
Contract: Processing is necessary to fulfill our obligations under our agreement with your school
Legitimate Interests: Processing is necessary for our legitimate interests in operating and improving the program, provided these interests do not override your rights
Legal Obligation: Processing is required to comply with applicable laws and regulations

subsection4_1.title: 4.1 Within the Platform
subsection4_1.content: Approved evidence may be shared publicly in our inspiration gallery to showcase school achievements and inspire other participants. Schools can control the visibility of their submissions.

subsection4_2.title: 4.2 Service Providers
subsection4_2.intro: We work with trusted third-party service providers who assist us in operating the platform:
items: Cloud Storage: Google Cloud Platform for file storage and database hosting
Email Services: SendGrid for transactional emails and communications
Authentication: Google OAuth for secure single sign-on
Analytics: Anonymized usage analytics to improve the platform
subsection4_2.outro: These providers are contractually bound to protect your data and only use it for the purposes we specify.

subsection4_3.title: 4.3 Program Partners
subsection4_3.content: We may share anonymized program statistics with our partners (Common Seas, Kids Against Plastic) for reporting and fundraising purposes. We do not share personal information without consent.

subsection4_4.title: 4.4 Legal Requirements
subsection4_4.content: We may disclose your information if required by law, court order, or government request, or to protect the rights, property, or safety of Plastic Clever Schools, our users, or the public.

section5.title: 5. Data Security
section5.intro: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your data:
items: Encryption: All data transmissions use HTTPS/TLS encryption
Password Protection: Passwords are hashed and salted using industry-standard algorithms
Access Controls: Role-based access ensures users only see data they're authorized to access
Secure Storage: Files and database records are stored on secure cloud infrastructure
Regular Backups: Data is regularly backed up to prevent loss
Monitoring: We monitor for unauthorized access and security vulnerabilities
section5.outro: While we strive to protect your data, no method of transmission or storage is 100% secure. Please use strong passwords and notify us immediately of any suspected security breaches.

section6.title: 6. Data Retention
section6.intro: We retain your information for as long as necessary to provide our services and fulfill the purposes described in this policy:
items: Active Accounts: Data is retained while your school account is active
Inactive Accounts: Accounts inactive for 3 years may be archived or deleted
Evidence Submissions: Approved evidence may be retained indefinitely for historical and inspirational purposes
Anonymized Data: Aggregated statistics may be retained permanently for research and reporting
Legal Requirements: Some data may be retained longer to comply with legal obligations
section6.outro: You may request deletion of your account at any time (see Your Rights section below).

section7.title: 7. Your Rights
section7.intro: Under GDPR and other data protection laws, you have the following rights:
items: Access: Request a copy of the personal data we hold about you
Rectification: Correct inaccurate or incomplete information
Erasure: Request deletion of your personal data (right to be forgotten)
Restriction: Request that we limit how we use your data
Portability: Receive your data in a machine-readable format
Objection: Object to certain types of processing (e.g., marketing)
Withdraw Consent: Withdraw consent at any time where we rely on consent
section7.outro: To exercise these rights, please contact us using the information provided at the end of this policy. We will respond within 30 days.

section8.title: 8. Cookies and Tracking Technologies
section8.intro: We use cookies and similar technologies to enhance your experience:
items: Essential Cookies: Required for authentication and basic platform functionality
Preference Cookies: Remember your language settings and display preferences
Analytics Cookies: Help us understand how users interact with the platform (anonymized)
section8.outro: You can control cookie settings through your browser preferences. Note that disabling essential cookies may limit platform functionality.

section9.title: 9. International Data Transfers
section9.paragraph1: The Plastic Clever Schools program operates globally. Your information may be transferred to and stored in countries outside your home country, including the United Kingdom and European Economic Area.
section9.paragraph2: When transferring data internationally, we ensure appropriate safeguards are in place:
items: EU-approved Standard Contractual Clauses with service providers
Data Processing Agreements that comply with GDPR requirements
Use of providers certified under recognized privacy frameworks

section10.title: 10. Children's Privacy
section10.paragraph1: While our program involves schools and students, we do not knowingly collect personal information directly from children under 13 (or under 16 in the EU) without parental consent.
section10.paragraph2: Teachers and schools are responsible for:
items: Obtaining appropriate parental/guardian consent before submitting photos or videos featuring students
Ensuring student privacy is protected in all submissions
Complying with COPPA, GDPR, and local child protection laws
Reviewing and approving all content before submission
section10.paragraph3: If we become aware that we have collected personal information from a child without proper consent, we will delete it promptly.

section11.title: 11. Third-Party Links
section11.paragraph1: Our platform may contain links to third-party websites, including partner organizations and educational resources. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of these external sites.
section11.paragraph2: We encourage you to review the privacy policies of any third-party sites you visit.

section12.title: 12. Changes to This Privacy Policy
section12.paragraph1: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices, legal requirements, or platform features.
section12.paragraph2: When we make significant changes, we will:
items: Update the "Last Updated" date at the top of this policy
Notify registered users via email or platform notification
Post a notice on the platform homepage
section12.paragraph3: Your continued use of the platform after changes take effect constitutes acceptance of the updated policy.

section13.title: 13. Contact Us & Data Protection Officer
section13.intro: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy, wish to exercise your data protection rights, or have privacy concerns, please contact us:
section13.outro: You also have the right to lodge a complaint with your local data protection authority if you believe we have not handled your data appropriately.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.paragraph1: Welcome to Plastic Clever Schools ("we," "our," or "us"). These Terms and Conditions govern your use of the Plastic Clever Schools platform and services. By accessing or using our platform, you agree to be bound by these terms.
introduction.paragraph2: Plastic Clever Schools is a global initiative managed by Common Seas in partnership with Kids Against Plastic, designed to help schools reduce single-use plastic and educate students about environmental responsibility.

section1.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
section1.intro: By registering your school or creating an account on the Plastic Clever Schools platform, you confirm that:
items: You are authorized to represent your educational institution
You are at least 18 years of age or have obtained parental/guardian consent
You agree to comply with all applicable laws and regulations
All information provided during registration is accurate and current

subsection2_1.title: 2.1 Account Security
subsection2_1.content: You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials and for all activities that occur under your account. You must notify us immediately of any unauthorized access or security breaches.

subsection2_2.title: 2.2 School Roles
subsection2_2.intro: Our platform supports multiple user roles within schools:
items: Head Teacher: Full administrative access to school account, team management, and evidence approval
Teacher: Ability to submit evidence, view resources, and participate in school activities
Pending Teacher: Limited access pending verification by head teacher

subsection2_3.title: 2.3 Acceptable Use
items: Upload false, misleading, or fraudulent evidence
Impersonate another school, teacher, or organization
Use the platform for commercial purposes without authorization
Interfere with the security or operation of the platform
Upload content that infringes intellectual property rights
Share inappropriate, offensive, or harmful content

subsection3_1.title: 3.1 Three-Stage Journey
subsection3_1.content: The Plastic Clever Schools program consists of three stages: Inspire, Investigate, and Act. Schools must complete evidence requirements for each stage in order to progress.

subsection3_2.title: 3.2 Evidence Submission
items: Original work created by your school community
Accurate and truthful representations of your activities
Compliant with student privacy and data protection regulations
Free from copyrighted material unless you have permission to use it

subsection3_3.title: 3.3 Evidence Review
subsection3_3.content: We reserve the right to review, approve, or reject any evidence submissions. Rejected evidence will include feedback for improvement. Schools may resubmit evidence after addressing feedback.

subsection3_4.title: 3.4 Award Recognition
subsection3_4.content: Schools that complete all three stages will receive Plastic Clever Schools recognition. We reserve the right to revoke recognition if evidence is found to be fraudulent or if schools violate these terms.

subsection4_1.title: 4.1 Your Content
subsection4_1.intro: You retain ownership of all content you upload to the platform (photos, videos, documents, etc.). By submitting content, you grant us a non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free license to use, display, and distribute your content for the purposes of:
items: Operating and improving the Plastic Clever Schools platform
Showcasing school achievements in our inspiration gallery
Promoting the program in marketing materials (with your school's consent)
Creating case studies to inspire other schools

subsection4_2.title: 4.2 Our Content
subsection4_2.content: All platform content, including resources, educational materials, logos, and branding, is owned by Common Seas and its partners. You may use these materials for educational purposes within your school but may not reproduce, distribute, or commercialize them without permission.

subsection4_3.title: 4.3 Student Privacy
subsection4_3.content: When submitting photos or videos featuring students, you confirm that you have obtained appropriate consent from parents/guardians and comply with all applicable data protection laws (including GDPR, COPPA, etc.).

section5.title: 5. Privacy and Data Protection
section5.paragraph1: Our Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your personal data. By using the platform, you consent to our data practices as described in the Privacy Policy. We are committed to protecting student privacy and complying with all applicable data protection regulations.

You submit fraudulent or misleading evidence
